decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
The marquee structure hereby approved shall only be erected and in situ for up to 152 days per year. Where the marquee is not in use it must be fully dismantled within three weeks of being vacated.
To ensure that the students and the general public benefit from the enhanced public realm and to maximise permeability in accordance with Policy DMHB 12 and DMHB 14 of the Local Plan (20212020)
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans, numbers
and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).
The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the following has been completed in accordance with the specified supporting plans and/or documents:
Brunel John Crank Building Redevelopment - Schedule of Materials
Landscaping Management and Maintenance Plan Revision P01
Site of Former John Crank Building Heritage Statement March 2023
Design and Access Statement Revised 12th September 2023 Rev P05
Thereafter the development shall be retained/maintained in accordance with these details for as long as the development remains in existence.
To ensure the development complies with the provisions Hillingdon Local Plan Parts 1 (November 2012) and 2 (January 2020) and the London Plan (2021).

(i) The proposed development shall be undertaken in consultation with an appropriately qualified contaminated land specialist. If further contamination is found then the following information shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
(a) Full details relating to the type of contamination found and it's location

(b) A written method statement providing details of the remediation scheme and how the completion of the remedial works will be verified shall be agreed in writing with the LPA prior to commencement, along with the details of a watching brief to address undiscovered contamination. No deviation shall be made from this scheme without the express agreement of the LPA prior to its implementation.

(ii) If during remedial or development works contamination not addressed in the submitted remediation scheme is identified an addendum to the remediation scheme shall be agreed with the LPA prior to implementation; and
(iii) Upon completion of the approved remedi

Prior to the installation of lighting, details of additional external lighting related to the development hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details shall exclude the approved uplighters and under-bench lighting, and include location, height, type and direction of light sources and intensity of illumination for additional light sources. The approved scheme shall be implemented prior to occupation and retained for the life of the development.

In the interests of the protection of the biodiversity in accordance with Policy EM7 of the Local Plan Part 1, Policy DMEI 7 and DMEI 8 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020) and London Plan (2021) Policy G6.

All trees, hedges and shrubs shown to be planted on the approved plan(s) shall be planted within the first planting season following the completion of the development or the occupation of the buildings. Any which are damaged, uprooted, felled within 5 years of the permission shall be replaced.

To ensure that the trees and other vegetation continue to make a valuable contribution to the amenity of the area in accordance with policy DMHB 14 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020) and to comply with Section 197 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
The proposed development shall be carried out in complete accordance with the Flood Risk and Drainage Strategy "Flood Risk Assessment March 2023".
To ensure the development does not increase the risk of flooding in accordance with Policy DMEI 10 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020) and Policy SI 12 of the London Plan (2021).

Notwithstanding the approved plans, the slope gradient for the proposed ramp shall be constructed at 1:21 and the 100 mm upstands shall be installed so not to create a trip hazard to users of the steps and slope.
To ensure the development complies with accessible standards in accordance with Policy D5 of the London Plan (2021)

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan - The Spatial Development Strategy for London consolidated with alterations since 2011 (2016) and national guidance.
description: The erection of a marquee and the redevelopment of the site to provide new hard and soft landscaping and associated works.

open_spaces_details.description: New landscaping on John Crank site and Ben Moxey Quad

application_details.scheme_name: Former John Crank Building and Ben Moxey Quad landscaping works and erection of a marquee
